text: Seymour Aubrey Papert (29 February 1928, Pretoria, Union of South Africa â€“ 31 July 2016, Maine, U.S.) was a groundbreaking mathematician, computer scientist, and educator. He spent his career at MIT. He was an early leader in the field of artificial intelligence. He is one of the founders of the constructivist movement in education. With Cynthia Solomon and Wally Feurzeig he invented the Logo Programing Language. He was co-director of the MIT Artificial Intelligence Lab with Marvin Minsky. He advocated for computers in education as a tool for constructivist education. His work influenced many 21st-century thinkers in American education. ==References== Category:Educators from Maine Category:American computer scientists Category:1928 births Category:2016 deaths Category:South African scientists Category:American mathematicians Category:Massachusetts Institute of Technology faculty
